result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A. Charles

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 16, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Christin Saint Pierre, for Public Defender.

Defendant Steven A. Charles in court.  Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Steven A. Charles.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and reserves all other jurisdictional rights and objections. 
Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar. 
Offer deadline: 11-04-2022

Order Denying Petition for Appointment of Counsel.
The petition is denied because the person is not indigent based on the letter submitted with information about his current income.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Steven A. Charles
Current: 1525 Green Street, Apt. 413, Sheboygan, WI 53081 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2022)
Prior: 2409 Dewey St # 12, Manitowoc, WI 54220

11:13 AM Defendant Steven A. Charles in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of the complaint, defendant is going to reapply for court appointed counsel.
Bail is set at $450 recognizance bond with the conditions that he is to have no contact with E.N. DOB: 05-18-1953. .  Bail furnished.
Court also orders the defendant to report to MTPD for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney is DENIED because the court finds that the person is not indigent.
